Comments_List: A solid introduction to ring and module theory, category theory, and a bit of homological algebra. A lot more experience working with universal properties.
Especially improved my commutative algebra and category theory knowledge.
I learned a broad range of techniques and concepts that are essential in modern algebra.
It's a very challenging and time-consuming course, but very rewarding.

Strengths: the course was taught through a very modern point of view, using category theory. Many classic definitions and theorems were stated using category theory, which was very interesting.
The fact that we had weekly homework helped to keep track with the class lectures.

Weaknesses: we did not have time to cover some topics, including Noetherian and Artinian rings.
The homework problems are pretty fun to solve and really enhanced my problem solving ability with modern algebra knowledge. It helped me make connections with other math fields I learned before.

Unfortunately, Zhiwei is leaving this Spring -- but I would still recommend taking modern algebra. The material is pretty essential for any math student. Hopefully whoever teaches it manages to bring it to life!
Yes. This is a very important course for anyone who is interested in commutative algebra and
